intro: Oxybaphus longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed oxybaphus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Oxybaphus longipes is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in grassland habitats.
